item.title: Devoxx UK 2022: Take a walk on the cient side
item.description: I spoke about creating command line applications at Devoxx UK in May. I wanted to change a few things the second time around, to see if I could get farther along with the application, but I was stymied again! No one texted me this time. Instead, my ipad and laptop fought with the projector over screen resolution. “We’re just going to code in the air.” See that blank screen behind @ebullientworks? Apparently her laptop doesn’t like the #DevoxxUK AV, but she’s rolling with it. It reminds me of @ixchelruiz’s virtuoso projection-free talk at Voxxed Milan, when 3 adapters let her down. pic.twitter.com/1FHYOGs6Gs — Holly Cummins (@holly_cummins) May 12, 2022 The subject of the talk is a little command line application called “Pockets”, and it lives here: https://github.com/ebullient/pockets-cli

Quarkus Insights #81 (host): Morphia and MongoDB object-document mapping
item.description: Justin Lee drops by to discuss MongoDB object-document mapping with the Quarkus Morphia extension. We talk about Morphia, MongoDB, and the whens/whys of “NoSQL” vs. SQL data sources.
